Interface amm.mail.MailSource 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Interface amm.mail.MailSource

public interface MailSource
extends Object
An interface implemented by classes that send mail via a Mailer.
See Also:
Mailer

cc()
Returns a list of addresses to cc the message to.
data(PrintStream)
This method allows the MailSource to send the content of the message.
done(boolean)
Called when the Mailer has completed the transaction.
from()
Returns the address that the mail is originating from.
host()
Returns the SMTP server's address (ie.
name()
Returns the name of the sender.
status(String)
Recevies status messages from the Mailer.
subject()
Returns the subject of the message.
to()
Returns a list of addresses to send the message to.

cc 
  public abstract String[] cc()
Returns a list of addresses to cc the message to.
Returns:
Each address in an element of the array.
to 
  public abstract String[] to()
Returns a list of addresses to send the message to.
Returns:
Each address is an element of the array.
from 
  public abstract String from()
Returns the address that the mail is originating from.
Returns:
The desired e-mail address.
name 
  public abstract String name()
Returns the name of the sender.
Returns:
The desired name.
subject 
  public abstract String subject()
Returns the subject of the message.
Returns:
The desired subject.
data 
  public abstract void data(PrintStream out)
This method allows the MailSource to send the content of the message.
Parameters:
out - A PrintStream to output the message body to.
See Also:
PrintStream
host 
  public abstract String host()
Returns the SMTP server's address (ie. smtp.nowhere.com).
Returns:
The desired address.
status 
  public abstract void status(String msg)
Recevies status messages from the Mailer. status typically displays the messages to a status bar or the Standard Output.
Parameters:
msg - The message from the Mailer.
done 
  public abstract void done(boolean succeeded)
Called when the Mailer has completed the transaction.
Parameters:
succeeded - True if the mail was send successfully.
